summary: The 'Farewell to Foam Act of 2025' aims to ban the sale and distribution of expanded polystyrene (EPS) products, commonly known as Styrofoam. Specifically, it prohibits the sale of EPS food service ware (cups, plates, etc.), loose fill packaging (packing peanuts), and coolers.  The ban phases in on January 1, 2028, with penalties for violations. The bill defines various terms related to EPS products and grants enforcement powers to the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). The EPA also has a role in possible state enforcement.
